pullrequest.title: Add Insert tab to model editor

content.raw:
Thanks for the info.

• I'm torn on the order of the tabs. Ideally, the Insert tab would have thumbnails of each model to make it look more Palette-like. The alphabetized list is a bit overwhelming and requires quite a bit of reading and searching to find the right thing. It would be great if the insert tab resembled the gzweb insert menu with an option to toggle between list view and thumbnail view (à la the Mac Finder: https://cdn.tutsplus.com/mac/authors/legacy/Josh%20Johnson/2012/07/13/findertips-5.jpg). This is still a long ways off, right? In either case, I would put the Insert tab as default, but that might be the right choice only for very beginners. It's the tab that is most understandable and relatable. The Settings are not too relevant to total novices. I can't judge how annoying it would be for users who want Settings to always have to click to that tab. So, I'd personally put the Insert tab as default, but I would also understand if you all think it's more convenient to have Settings as default. 

• Does it matter if the user knows the difference between single- and multi-link models? How will it affect them?
